{ "step_by_step_thinking": "First, let's understand what each syndrome is. Mohr's syndrome is a rare genetic disorder characterized by certain abnormalities of the oral cavity and phalanges. Extra cusps on teeth are a common feature of this syndrome. Rubinstein Taybi Syndrome is a condition characterized by short stature, moderate to severe intellectual disability, distinctive facial features, and broad thumbs and first toes. Extra cusps on teeth can also be a feature of this syndrome. Proteus Syndrome is a rare condition characterized by overgrowth of the bones, skin, and other tissues. Teeth abnormalities can occur in this syndrome. Sturge-Weber Syndrome is a neurological disorder indicated at birth by a port-wine stain birthmark on the forehead and upper eyelid of one side of the face. The syndrome is not typically associated with dental abnormalities.", "answer_choice": "B. Sturge-Weber Syndrome" }
